OriginalArticle.ValueInfo:
The head of Xunyang River sends off the guests at night.
The maple leaves and dilly flowers in autumn.

He wanted to drink with no pipes and strings.
I am not happy to be drunk, but I am sad to say goodbye.

The pipa stopped sounding and wanted to speak late.
I moved the boat and invited them to see each other.
Adding wine to the lamp and reopening the banquet.
A thousand calls to come out, but
The lute is still clasping its face.
Turning the shaft and plucking the strings, three or two sounds
Before the tune is finished, there is love.
The strings are hiding the thoughts.
It seems to be a complaint of a lifetime of unrequited ambition.
The low brows and the formalities continue to play.
Tell all the infinite things in your heart.
Gently and slowly twist and smear again and again.
The first is "Neisang" and the second is "Liuyou".
The big strings are as noisy as the rapid rain.
The small strings are like whispers.
The noises are mixed up and played

At this moment, no sound is better than a sound.

The iron cavalry protrudes from the swords and spears.

The four strings sound like cracked silk.

The only thing I can see is the white moon in the center of the river.
The song is played in the strings.
I have to dress up and restrain my face.
She said she was a woman from the capital.

The name belongs to the first part of the teaching workshop.
After the song, I was taught to be good at dressing.

The five young people of the mausoleum compete for the head.
I don't know the number of red images in a song.
The silver grate at the head of the tin is broken.
The blood-colored dress is stained with wine.
This year's laughter will be repeated next year.
The autumn, the moon and the spring breeze are spent at leisure.
My aunt died when I left for the army.
The color is the same as it was in the past.
The saddle and horses are scarce in front of the door.
The oldest married a merchant's wife.
The merchant is more concerned with profit than parting.
The month before last, I went to buy tea in Furiang.
I came to the mouth of the river to guard the empty boat.
The moonlight around the boat is cold.
Late at night, I suddenly dreamed of my youth.
Dreams cry for tears and red appendages.
I heard the pipa already sighing.
I heard the same words again.
We are all fallen people at the end of the earth.
Why do we have to meet before?
I resigned from the imperial capital last year.
I was relegated to Xunyang City.
Xunyang is a remote place with no music.
The whole year does not hear the sound of silk and bamboo.
Live near the Pen River, low humidity, the
Yellow reeds and bitter bamboo grow around the house.
What do you hear at night and day?
The cuckoo cries blood and the ape cries.
In the spring river, flowers, autumn and moonlit nights
I often take wine and pour it alone.
Are there no mountain songs and village flutes?
It is difficult to listen to them.
Tonight, I heard your pipa language.
Like listening to immortal music, my ears are clear for a while.
Why don't you sit down and play a song?
For you, I will write "Pipa Xing".
I have been standing for a long time, feeling my words.
But the strings are sharply turned.
It is not like the previous sound.
The whole audience heard it again and hid their sobs.
Who sobbed the most in the audience?
The Secretary of Jiangzhou was wet.

Look back at the blood and tears flowing together.

Looking back at the world of people.

I will send it away.
The hairpin is left in one strand and combined with a fan.

We will see each other in heaven and on earth.

On the seventh day of the seventh month, in the Hall of Eternal Life
In the middle of the night, when no one is whispering.

On earth, I wish to be a couple.

Life is endless from generation to generation.

But I see the Yangtze River sending flowing water.

On the green maple pond, I am full of sorrow.

May the moon flow to shine on you.

The slanting moon sinks and hides the sea fog.
The road to Jieshi Xiaoxiang is infinite.
I don't know how many people have returned by the moon.
The falling moon is full of love in the river trees.

ItemDescription.Value: A collection of miscellaneous novels written by Liu Xiang of the Western Han Dynasty, containing some historical stories and legends from the pre-Qin period to the Western Han Dynasty.
One of the Confucian classics, it mainly summarizes the theory of moral cultivation of pre-Qin Confucianism, as well as the basic principles and methods about moral cultivation.
One of the classics of Confucianism, it is a monograph of moral philosophy that deals with the state of cultivation of life in the generation.
It is a collection of quotations compiled by the disciples and re-disciples of Confucius to record the words and actions of Confucius and his disciples.
One of the classics of Confucianism, it records the political, educational, philosophical and ethical views and political activities of Mencius and his disciples.
One of the Five Classics of Confucianism, the Shi Jing is a general collection of poetry that reflects the richness of society from the Western Zhou to the Spring and Autumn periods.
One of the Five Classics of Confucianism, it is a compilation of ancient historical documents and some writings tracing ancient events.

It is one of the Five Classics of Confucianism, an important anthology of canonical systems. The main content of the book is the ritual system of the pre-Qin Dynasty, which embodies the philosophical, educational, political and aesthetic thoughts of the pre-Qin Confucianists.
One of the Confucian texts, it is a chronological history book and the state history of the state of Lu during the Zhou dynasty.

One of the Confucian classics, the contents include two parts, the Sutra and the Chuan. The Sutra mainly consists of the 64 hexagrams and the 384 lines. The "Chuan" contains the interpretation of the hexagrams and the lines of the test text.
One of the traditional enlightenment textbooks, it is said to have been written by Wang Yinglin, a scholar of the Song Dynasty.
The author is unknown, and is a book manual dedicated to various ancient inkstones.
The history of the use of incense, the use of incense methods, and a variety of incense formulas have been widely collected.
A monograph on wine culture, with stories, poems and wine orders related to wine, is an important material for understanding the culture of wine orders and folklore.
A monograph on the method of making sugar from sugarcane.
Cai Xiang felt Lu Yu "tea" "not the first Jian'an products" and specially recommended to the emperor Beiyuan tribute tea, thus writing "tea record".

This "Pingzhai Â¢ji" is a collection of poems and writings of Hong Zai Kui (No. Pingzhai), a poet of the Song Dynasty. The book contains thirty-two volumes, the collection is divided into: ancient fu, poems, notes, preface, aphorisms, inscriptions, miscellaneous essays, fenghua, zao, tables, internal and external systems, qi, lectures, stories, questions, epitaphs, sacrificial texts and other subjects.

This "Yangchun Baixue" was selected and edited by Zhao Â¢li of the Song Dynasty. The book is divided into eight volumes of the main collection and one volume of the outer collection, with a total of six hundred and seventy-one words and more than two hundred and thirty writers. The eight volumes of the main collection are mainly works of ebullience and elegance, while the outer collection contains more bold and mournful works of Zhang Yuangan, Xin Qiji, Liu Guo and others.
The Buddha's Fruit Huanwu Zen Master Biyan Record, also known as the Biyan Record, is a collection of Buddhist Zen discourses edited by Zen Master Huanwu Hakkak.

This "Wuxing Zhi" is an official local history compiled by Li Jinghe, the governor of Huzhou, and other officials during the Jiatai period of the Southern Song Dynasty, and was compiled by Gui'an Tangyao.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> A Memoir of Peonies in Luoyang </color>

ItemDescription.Value: It describes in detail the characteristics of various peony species, the origin of their names, the customs of peony viewing in Luoyang and the cultivation techniques of peony.

This "Complete Works of Zhou Zi" is a compilation of the writings of Zhou Dunyi, a Northern Song scholar. It consists of six volumes and contains Zhou Dunyi's writings as well as later accounts and commentaries on Zhou.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> The Collected Poems of Meng Haoran </color>

ItemDescription.Value: This collection of poems of Meng Haoran was compiled by Wang Shiyuan of the Tang Dynasty. It contains about 214 poems by Meng Haoran, a famous poet of the Tang Dynasty. Meng Haoran was an expert poet, especially in five lines, and he was good at writing landscapes and idyllic scenes, and was known as "Wang Meng" along with Wang Wei.

This "Ancient Jade Atlas" was written by imperial decree in the Song Dynasty, including Long Dabuan. It is divided into thirty-two volumes, including national treasures, presses, clothing and royalty, literature, ding and yi, and shizhong, and musical instruments, and records the jade collected in the imperial palace during the reign of Emperor Gaozong, with one or two diagrams and an article describing its size, shape, ornamentation and use.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF9A00FF> The Western Regions of the Great Tang </color>

ItemDescription.Value: The book is known as "The Book of the Western Regions", which was dictated by the famous Tang monk Xuanzang and compiled by his disciple Fanji. The book consists of twelve volumes, which is a record of Xuanzang's travels in India and the West during his nineteen-year journey, including the customs and customs of more than one hundred countries from Xinjiang to South India, providing a large amount of Indian historical materials.

It is one of the four major books of the Song Dynasty. It specializes in wild histories as well as miscellaneous novels, among which are thought to be gods and immortals, ghosts, retribution, gods, female immortals, fixed numbers, animals and beasts, grasses and trees, regeneration, foreign monks, and eleven categories of signs and responses. Most of the novels in the book are works of the Tang Dynasty, such as the Six Dynasties and the Legends of the Tang Dynasty.

It is one of the four major books of the Song Dynasty. The "Song will be", the "Taiping imperial guide" is based on the "Xiuwendian imperial guide", "Arts and Letters", "Wenshi Bozuo" and other books as a model for compilation. Song Minqiu "Chunming Retreat" said "after the book was completed, Taizong day to read three volumes, a year and read weeks, so given is also the name.

The Zizhi Tongjian is a chronicle of history from the Warring States period to the end of the Five Dynasties, compiled by historian Sima Guang and others. The first part of this book is written in Sima Guang's handwriting, which records the historical facts of the first year of the first year of Yongchang of the Yuan Emperor of the Eastern Jin Dynasty. The latter part is a statement of thanks to people for their favors in Sima Guang's handwriting.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF9A00FF> "Watching the Elephant and Playing with the Cham" </color>

ItemDescription.Value: The book is a study of divination and astrology, written by Li Chunfeng in the Tang Dynasty, which preserves a large amount of ancient astronomical data and is of great historical value.

The book is divided into five volumes: benevolence, righteousness, propriety, wisdom, and faith. It is a monograph on the style of the guqin, commenting on its schools, manufacturing processes, performance techniques, notation systems, and theories of musical aesthetics.

The Mengxi Pensi is a work by Shen Kuo. It is a comprehensive work of notes on natural science, technology and social and historical phenomena. It is divided into twenty-six volumes: stories, dialectic, music and rhythm, elephant and number, personnel, government, power and wisdom, art and literature, calligraphy and painting, arts and crafts, utensils, magic, magazines, etc.

It is one of the four major books of the Song Dynasty. It contains poems, songs and lines, miscellaneous writings, as well as imperial edicts, book judgments, tables and records from the Southern Liang Dynasty to the Five Dynasties, and can be used to examine historical facts. Nine tenths of the works of Tang people are included.
A monograph on fruit cultivation.
A record of the lectures given by both Roy Cheng and Cheng Yi.
An ancient book that brings together poems, stories and miscellany of famous people to praise the graceful quality of begonias.
A book of ancient texts.
A book that describes the famous Mount Lushan's victory, the content introduces the origin of Mount Lushan, geographical location, shape, scenery, monuments, temples, and historical legends.
There are more than 30 species of chrysanthemums recorded in the book. In addition to the shape and color, the book also contains the origin.
The official rhyme book, arranged according to the phonetic division of Chinese characters into rhymes.
Qin Guan's poems and essays are collected in a total of seven hundred and twenty pieces.
An important notebook that preserves much of the historical material on cultural and social history.
A long travelogue about daily travel life, natural and humanistic landscapes, world customs, military and politics, and poetry and palimpsests.
A piece of essay in Su Shi's Yinliangjin scroll. Jia Yi is a famous person in history who died of depression because of his lack of talent.

The whole article is tightly focused on "the world's situation", discussing the successes and failures of the six kingdoms in their struggle with Qin for the world, dissecting layers and penetrating into the heart of the matter, and talking through the "plan of self-security". The article is also a stream of notes that twists and turns to the fullest.

An essay by Su Xun. He believes that there is a certain pattern in everything, and if one can observe carefully and grasp the pattern, one can see the smallest things and know the smallest things. Therefore, by observing the behavior, one can find the traitorous officials before the disaster occurs.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> The Collected Works of Wang Moji </color>

ItemDescription.Value: Wang Wei's collection of poems and essays is divided into ten volumes, with more than four hundred essays in total, including songs, poems and praises, book prefaces, epigraphs, tomb inscriptions, and miscellaneous poems.

It focuses on the old part of the Tang Dynasty and the situation of Chang'an and its affiliated counties since the upper to Han Dynasty. The contents include Chang'an's markets, streets, palaces and official residences; the politics and official positions of Yongzhou Prefecture and counties; local rivers and canals, customs and products, etc.

The collection includes more than 200 objects, including bells, tripods, and rituals, for each of which the name, mark, and form are written and interpreted, and the provenance and collector are also recorded.
A monograph describing the situation of tribute tea from the beginning of the Song Dynasty to the time of Xuanhe.
It is a collection of more than 300 kinds of plants, including flowers, fruits, plants and trees.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> A Brief History of the Eastern Capital </color>

ItemDescription.Value: A chronicle-style history of the nine Northern Song dynasties, containing mainly a series of biographies.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> The Great Song Re-dedication of Guang Yun </color>

ItemDescription.Value: The first official revision of the rhyme book.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> The Collected Works of Mr. Hedong </color>

ItemDescription.Value: It is a collection of works by Liu Zongyuan of the Tang Dynasty. Liu Zongyuan attaches great importance to the content of his essays and advocates that the essays should be written in a way that is clear and feasible for the country and the people.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> The Remainder of the Eastern View </color>

ItemDescription.Value: A theoretical work on the theory of calligraphy, jinshu, and the identification of falsification of legal texts.

It records the historical facts of the five dynasties from the beginning of the Song Dynasty to King Yingzong. The book is mainly in the style of chronicles and biographies, mixed with the style of meeting: volumes 1 to 3 record the stories of the five dynasties, and volumes 4 to 20 are biographies of people.

The historian Lou Ji thought that the official script is the previous body of the regular script, and the correct understanding of the official script is extremely helpful to the correct use of the regular script, so he compiled this book.
The book contains more than 300 pieces, including bronze and miscellaneous wares, seals, etc.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> The Collected Poems of Mr. Donglai </color>

ItemDescription.Value: It is the work of LÃ¼ Benzhong of the Jiangxi school of poetry.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> The Book of the House of the Turtle </color>

ItemDescription.Value: The first of the four major books. The book is rich in material, with whole quotations, from the ancient times to the Five Dynasties, compiled by people, events, and things, in chronological order.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> The Long and Short Phrases of Cascade </color>

ItemDescription.Value: The collection of Xin Qiji's words is a collection of more than 500 words.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> The Book of Kao-Gong-Ji, The Book of the Clown </color>

ItemDescription.Value: The book contains nearly 70 prints of beautiful artifacts.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> The Chronicle of a Traveling Eunuch </color>

ItemDescription.Value: A historical notebook of the Song Dynasty, recording his travels to Sichuan and Jianghuai in terms of folklore, anecdotes, local conditions, as well as art and literature, elementary school, archaeology, calendars, magic, medicine, and horticulture.
Historical Notes This book covers a wide range of content, including the hundred schools of scripture and history, literature and art, Song dynasty stories and character evaluation.

Su Zhe's work on the Poetic Edda. The entire book consists of twenty volumes: eight volumes of the State Wind, seven volumes of the Xiaoya, three volumes of the Daya, one volume of the Zhou Ode, and one volume of the Lu Ode and Shang Ode together.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> The Book of Public Opinion and Geography </color>

ItemDescription.Value: Thirty-eight volumes, the first four volumes of the book first narrate the territory of the past generations, five volumes later, respectively, listed in the Song dynasty road, state and county and narrate the history of the past generations, the former states and counties in the Song dynasty did not have, still attached to the road under the, detailed description of the present and slightly ancient, vertical and horizontal combination.

Name.ValueInfo: <color=#FF00B6FF> The Seven Signs of the Cloud </color>

ItemDescription.Value: A collection of Taoist teachings and doctrines, the origin of Taoism, the transmission of scriptures, secret techniques and methods, the qi methods of various schools, the golden elixir, prescriptions and medicines, etc., known as "Xiao Dao Zang".

This fugue recounts what the author and his friends saw and felt during a moonlit night boat trip to the Red Cliff. It takes the author's subjective feelings as a clue, and reflects the author's relaxation during the moonlit night boat trip, his sadness and sorrow for the past and the present, and his spiritual liberation through a question and answer format.

One of the earliest catalogs and research monographs on gold and stone. It contains thirty volumes of inscriptions and inscriptions on bells, cinges, and ritual objects, as well as stone inscriptions on tombs, from the Third Dynasty to the Fifth Dynasty of the Sui, Tang, and other periods.

A rhyme book repaired by the government, with five volumes: 28 rhymes for the upper flat voice, 29 rhymes for the lower flat voice, 55 rhymes for the upper voice, 60 rhymes for the lower voice, and 34 rhymes for the entering voice.

This book is a collection of 100 volumes by the Zen master Yongming Yanshu, detailing the words of the Zen masters and the tenets of important sutras and treatises, and presenting the essence of all Buddhism by cutting out the complicated texts.

The content is a mixture of the two Confucian and Taoist ideas of "the oneness of heaven and man", and is categorized by the five elements, listing the various "evidence of rest" and "evidence of blame" in all dynasties since the Spring and Autumn Period.
